# MKCircleView

**Class**

Provides the visual representation for an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKCircle] annotation object.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class MKCircleView
```

## Overview

This view fills and strokes the circle represented by the annotation. You can change the color and other drawing attributes of the circle by modifying the properties inherited from the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKOverlayPathView] class. This class is typically used as is and not subclassed.

Use of this class is discouraged in iOS 7 and later. Use the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKCircleRenderer] class instead.

## Classes

- **MKOverlayView**: Defines the basic behavior associated with all overlay views.
- **MKOverlayPathView**: Represents a generic overlay that draws its contents using a Core Graphics path data type.
- **MKPolygonView**: Provides the visual representation for an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKPolygon] annotation object.
- **MKPolylineView**: Provides the visual representation for an [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKPolyline] annotation object.
- **MKPinAnnotationView**: An annotation view that displays a pin image on the map.

## Inherits From

- MKOverlayPathView

## Conforms To

- CALayerDelegate
- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable

- NSObjectProtocol
